title: U.S. to Probe Tariff-Dodging Claim Against Chinese Manufacturers
sub_head: The issue pits U.S. solar manufacturers against installers who use imported cells and modules
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Department of Commerce said Monday that it will investigate whether Chinese solar producers are illegally circumventing solar tariffs by routing operations through four countries in Southeast Asia.
The investigation could culminate in the imposition of significant tariffs on solar cells and modules from Chinese companies operating out of Cambodia, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia.
